Event.name: Putting_out_fire
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Fire</fen> to no longer burn.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing an actor or an undergoer of an action during their participation in the event. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the state of an <fen>Agent</fen> that affects the nature of the event as the <fen>Agent</fen> brings about the end of the <fen>Fire</fen>.
<ex>The firefighters <fex name="Manner">heroically</fex> <t>extinguished</t> the flames.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> puts out the <fen>Fire</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> goes out.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group that causes the <fen>Fire</fen> to no longer burn.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The firefighters</fex> <t>extinguished</t> the wildfire.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Fire
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The combustion process that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to end.
<ex>It took four days before <fex name="Fire">the fire</fex>was <t>extinguished</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> puts out a <fen>Fire</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> puts out the <fen>Fire</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the how near the <fen>Agent</fen> is to puting out the <fen>Fire</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
</def-root>

lexUnit.name: douse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Extinguish (a fire) by pouring nonflammable fluid

lexUnit.name: smother.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Cause (a fire) to end by means of placing impermeable object or substance on it

lexUnit.name: extinguish.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Cause (a fire) to cease to burn

lexUnit.name: stamp out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Extinguish (a fire) by forcefully applying one's feet

lexUnit.name: snuff out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Extinguish (a flame) with a pinch or instrument such as a douter
